Alexandre P.  Furlan

PhD Physics | Researcher | Professor | Data Engineer

I studied physics at Universidade Federal do Paran√° (Curitiba, Brazil), where I developed a strong foundation in theoretical and computational methods. Later, I earned my M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees from Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (Porto Alegre, Brazil), with a collaborative research period at the Statistical Mechanics and Condensed Matter Group of the Institute of Physical Chemistry Rocasolano (Madrid, Spain). My doctoral and postdoctoral work focused on statistical mechanics, phase transitions, and complex systems, particularly in lattice gas models and associating fluids. From 2017 to 2021, I worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the Physics Department of Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (Belo Horizonte, Brazil), under suppervision of Prof. Ronald Dickman. My research explored: - Jamming and percolation phenomena in restricted-valence systems (Phys. Rev. Research). - Phase transitions in associating lattice gases, revealing critical behaviors analogous to liquid-liquid equilibria (Phys. Rev. E). - Water-like anomalies in confined systems and mixtures, providing insights into thermodynamic and structural properties (J. Chem. Phys.). - Ecological modeling, where I applied statistical physics to study habitat fragmentation and species survival (Physica A).

Building on my physics research background, I've transitioned into data engineering, progressing from data analysis to technical leadership. My career began developing Power BI dashboards and implementing business rules as a Data Analyst. This evolved into building robust data infrastructure as a Data Engineer, where I configured AWS services (EMR, EKS), automated deployments with Terraform, and orchestrated Spark jobs via Airflow. As a Platform Engineer at Z-Tech/BEES, I designed and managed cloud infrastructure on Azure, developing CI/CD pipelines with Kubernetes and creating data observability systems using Airflow and PySpark. Currently, as Tech Lead at BEES, I lead data platform initiatives including a secure Databricks Delta-sharing solution for partner collaboration and an innovative automation framework integrating Jira with Terraform for infrastructure management. Beyond technical projects, I mentor team members and contribute to technical hiring, fostering team growth while maintaining hands-on involvement in system architecture and implementation. My work consistently focuses on creating scalable, automated solutions that bridge business needs with technical execution, applying the same analytical rigor from my academic research to solve complex data challenges.
